com.phunware.engagement.messages

Interface MessageManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MessageManagerImpl

    public MessageManager

    MessageManager provides a means to manage Messages. You can also supply a MessageListener to be notified of message related events.

    To receive message events when your Activity is in the foreground, or to perform actions like updating the application UI or displaying additional information, add a MessageListener via the MessageManager.addMessageListener method. Note that you must also remove the listener via MessageManager.removeMessageListener to avoid leaks.

    See Also:
    MessageManager.addMessageListener, MessageManager.removeMessageListener

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String ACTION_MESSAGE_ADDED 
      java.lang.String ACTION_MESSAGE_REMOVED 
      java.lang.String ACTION_MESSAGE_UPDATED 
      java.lang.String ADD_MESSAGE 
      java.lang.String EXTRA_HAS_EXTRAS 
      java.lang.String EXTRA_MESSAGE 
      java.lang.String MIME_MESSAGE 
      java.lang.String SINGLE_BROADCAST_MESSAGE 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addMessageListener()
      Add a MessageListener to receive events for a Message Be sure to remove the listener when it is no longer needed using MessageManager.removeMessageListener
      void getMessage()
      Retrieves a specific message from the database via it's id.
      void getMessages()
      Retrieves undeleted Messages from the local database.
      void getUnreadMessages()
      Retrieves all unread Messages from the local database.
      void removeMessageListener()
      Remove a MessageListener from the MessageManager.
      void setMessageDeleted()
      Removes the Message from the local database. The result will be the message or an error if something went wrong.
      void setMessageRead()
      Sets the Message as read, and submits a MESSAGE_IMPRESSION event to the server.
